description.zh-cn: 日本干细胞科学家，现任京都大学教授。他因在诱导多能干细胞（iPS细胞）领域的研究而与约翰·格登共同获得2012年诺贝尔生理学或医学奖。
description.en: A Japanese stem cell researcher and a professor at Kyoto University. He was awarded the 2012 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine jointly with Sir John Gurdon for his work on induced pluripotent stem cells (iPS cells).

description.zh-cn: 日本科学家，山中伸弥在奈良先端科学技术大学院大学的博士班学生，与山中伸弥共同开创了诱导性多功能干细胞（iPS细胞）研究。
description.en: A Japanese scientist who was Shinya Yamanaka's doctoral student at the Nara Institute of Science and Technology and co-pioneered the research on induced pluripotent stem cells (iPS cells) with him.

description.zh-cn: 山中伸弥在大阪市立大学攻读博士学位时的导师。
description.en: Shinya Yamanaka's doctoral advisor at Osaka City University.

description.zh-cn: 英国发育生物学家，因发现成熟细胞可被重写成多功能细胞与山中伸弥同获2012年诺贝尔生理学或医学奖。其早期研究为iPS细胞的发现奠定了基础。
description.en: A British developmental biologist who shared the 2012 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with Shinya Yamanaka for the discovery that mature cells can be reprogrammed to become pluripotent. His early research laid the groundwork for the discovery of iPS cells.

description.zh-cn: 日本免疫学家，曾任大阪大学校长。他支持了山中伸弥的早期研究，帮助其获得完成iPS细胞奠基性研究的经费。
description.en: A Japanese immunologist and former president of Osaka University. He supported Shinya Yamanaka's early research, helping him secure funding to complete the foundational work on iPS cells.

description.zh-cn: 位于日本兵库县神户市的国立大学，是山中伸弥获得医学士学位的母校。
description.en: A national university in Kobe, Hyogo, Japan, and the alma mater where Shinya Yamanaka received his M.D.

description.zh-cn: 位于日本大阪府大阪市的公立大学，是山中伸弥获得医学博士学位的母校。
description.en: A public university in Osaka, Osaka Prefecture, Japan, and the alma mater where Shinya Yamanaka received his Ph.D. in Medicine.

nodes.id: 国立病院机构大阪医疗センター

zh-cn: 国立病院机构大阪医疗センター
en: National Hospital Organization Osaka National Hospital

description.zh-cn: 位于日本大阪市的医院，山中伸弥在完成学业后曾在此担任矫形外科医师。
description.en: A hospital in Osaka, Japan, where Shinya Yamanaka worked as an orthopedic surgeon after completing his studies.

zh-cn: 格拉德斯通心血管病研究所

description.zh-cn: 位于美国加州旧金山的独立非营利生物医学研究机构，隶属于加州大学旧金山分校。山中伸弥曾在此进行博士后研究，现亦担任该所高等研究员。
description.en: An independent, non-profit biomedical research organization in San Francisco, California, affiliated with the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF). Shinya Yamanaka conducted postdoctoral research here and currently serves as a Senior Investigator.

nodes.id: 奈良先端科学技术大学院大学

zh-cn: 奈良先端科学技术大学院大学
en: Nara Institute of Science and Technology

description.zh-cn: 位于日本奈良县生驹市的国立大学法人。山中伸弥曾在此担任副教授，并开始iPS细胞研究。
description.en: A national university corporation located in Ikoma, Nara, Japan. Shinya Yamanaka served as an associate professor here and began his iPS cell research.

nodes.id: 京都大学ウイルス・再生医科学研究所

zh-cn: 京都大学ウイルス・再生医科学研究所
京都大学再生医科学研究所
en: Institute for Frontier Life and Medical Sciences, Kyoto University

description.zh-cn: 京都大学下属的研究所，山中伸弥在2004年至2010年期间在此担任教授。
description.en: A research institute affiliated with Kyoto University, where Shinya Yamanaka was a professor from 2004 to 2010.

description.zh-cn: 位于日本京都府京都市的国立大学，是山中伸弥的主要工作单位。
description.en: A national university in Kyoto, Japan, and Shinya Yamanaka's primary place of employment.

en: Center for iPS Cell Research and Application

description.zh-cn: 京都大学下属的研究机构，致力于iPS细胞研究。山中伸弥是该所的所长和教授。
description.en: A research institution at Kyoto University dedicated to iPS cell research. Shinya Yamanaka serves as its director and a professor.

description.zh-cn: 日本国的中央政府。
description.en: The central government of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 一种由体细胞经过重编程技术得到的多能干细胞。该技术由山中伸弥团队于2006年首次成功实现，为再生医学开辟了新的可能性，并避免了使用胚胎干细胞的伦理争议。
description.en: A type of pluripotent stem cell generated from somatic cells through reprogramming techniques. This technology was first successfully achieved by Shinya Yamanaka's team in 2006, opening up new possibilities in regenerative medicine and avoiding the ethical controversies associated with embryonic stem cells.

nodes.id: 诺贝尔生理学或医学奖

zh-cn: 诺贝尔生理学或医学奖
en: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine

description.zh-cn: 诺贝尔奖的一个奖项，每年由瑞典卡罗琳斯卡学院的诺贝尔大会颁发，以表彰在生理学或医学领域作出重要发现的科学家。
description.en: One of the Nobel Prizes, awarded annually by the Nobel Assembly at the Karolinska Institute in Sweden to scientists who have made the most important discoveries in the fields of physiology or medicine.

description.zh-cn: 美国最高学术荣誉团体之一，由科学家和工程师组成，致力于为国家提供科学、技术和医学方面的独立、客观的建议。
description.en: One of the highest academic honors in the United States, composed of scientists and engineers, dedicated to providing independent, objective advice to the nation on matters related to science, technology, and medicine.

description.zh-cn: 梵蒂冈的科学学院，旨在促进数学、物理和自然科学的进步以及相关认识论问题的研究。
description.en: The scientific academy of the Vatican City, established to promote the progress of the mathematical, physical, and natural sciences and the study of related epistemological problems.

description.zh-cn: 日本文部科学省的特别机关，旨在表彰在学术上取得卓越成就的科学家，并为日本的学术发展提供支持。
description.en: A special organization under the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan, established to honor scientists with outstanding academic achievements and to support the advancement of science in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 三浦克之是山中伸弥攻读博士学位时的导师。
description.en: Katsuyuki Miura was Shinya Yamanaka's doctoral advisor.

description.zh-cn: 高桥和利是山中伸弥在奈良先端科学技术大学院大学的博士生，两人共同开始了诱导性多功能干细胞（iPS细胞）的研究。
description.en: Kazutoshi Takahashi was a doctoral student under Shinya Yamanaka at the Nara Institute of Science and Technology, where they began research on induced pluripotent stem cells (iPS cells) together.

relationships.target: 国立病院机构大阪医疗センター

position.zh-cn: 博士后研究员、高等研究员

description.zh-cn: 1993年至1996年在此进行博士后研究，后担任该所高等研究员。
description.en: Conducted postdoctoral research from 1993 to 1996, and later became a Senior Investigator at the institute.

relationships.target: 奈良先端科学技术大学院大学

description.zh-cn: 1999年至2003年在此担任副教授，后被授予荣誉教授职位。
description.en: Served as an Associate Professor from 1999 to 2003 and was later awarded the title of Honorary Professor.

relationships.target: 京都大学ウイルス・再生医科学研究所

relationships.source: 京都大学ウイルス・再生医科学研究所

description.zh-cn: 山中伸弥及其团队于2006年首次从成年小鼠的成纤维细胞中产生诱导多能干细胞(iPS细胞)，开创了这一全新的研究领域。
description.en: In 2006, Shinya Yamanaka and his team were the first to generate induced pluripotent stem cells (iPS cells) from adult mouse fibroblasts, pioneering this entirely new field of research.

description.zh-cn: 约翰·格登在1962年的研究中证实，分化的体细胞核具有恢复多能性的潜力。这一突破性发现为后来的iPS细胞研究提供了关键的理论基础。
description.en: In his 1962 research, John Gurdon demonstrated that differentiated somatic cell nuclei have the potential to revert to a pluripotent state. This breakthrough finding provided the key theoretical foundation for the subsequent research on iPS cells.

description.zh-cn: 在岸本忠三的支持下，山中伸弥于2003年获得了政府经费，这笔资金对于他完成iPS细胞的奠基性研究至关重要。
description.en: With the support of Tadamitsu Kishimoto, Shinya Yamanaka received government funding in 2003, which was crucial for him to complete the foundational research on iPS cells.

description.zh-cn: 为推动iPS细胞研究的实用化，日本政府于2007年决定在5年内投入70亿日圆进行支持。
description.en: To promote the practical application of iPS cell research, the Japanese government decided in 2007 to provide 7 billion yen in support over five years.

relationships.source: 诺贝尔生理学或医学奖

description.zh-cn: 因“发现成熟细胞可被重写成多功能细胞”而授予山中伸弥2012年诺贝尔生理学或医学奖。
description.en: Awarded the 2012 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine to Shinya Yamanaka for the discovery that mature cells can be reprogrammed to become pluripotent.

relationships.source: 诺贝尔生理学或医学奖

description.zh-cn: 因“发现成熟细胞可被重写成多功能细胞”而授予约翰·格登2012年诺贝尔生理学或医学奖。
description.en: Awarded the 2012 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine to Sir John Gurdon for the discovery that mature cells can be reprogrammed to become pluripotent.

description.zh-cn: 因在细胞重编程领域的贡献，两人共同获得了2012年诺贝尔生理学或医学奖。
description.en: They were jointly awarded the 2012 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their contributions to the field of cell reprogramming.
